etymology.description: 木 “tree” + 目 “eye” - an eye looking at a tree; original for “to observe,” later jiajie for “mutually.”
etymology.interpretation: Combines an eye and a tree to depict careful looking or inspection. The observing sense then got borrowed to write a homophonous word meaning “mutual,” which survives in modern compounds like 互相.

examples.chinese: 我们互相帮助(我們互相幫助)。
他善于相马(他善於相馬)。
examples.english: He is skilled at judging horses.

examples.chinese: 她的相貌很端正(她的相貌很端正)。
